document_data.name: Djim
document_data.mainbody: '''Djim''' were a type of [[memedi]] native to [[Kara-Tur]].
document_data.Description: Djim were incorporeal and resembled a balding aged [[human]] male. They wore prayer robes that flowed just past their feet. When encountered, djim avoided making eye contact and were heard constantly murmuring religious chants.
document_data.Combat: Like all common memedi, djim were harmless and avoided all combat. If attacked, they merely vanished.
document_data.Abilities: If a human saw a djim unexpectedly, they were struck with an effect similar to that of a ''[[fear]]'' spell.
document_data.Society: Djim were solitary creatures. They most often appeared at funerals for nobles and other important males in Kara-Tur. They only appeared at a funeral if a complex ritual was performed exactly as required. This ritual had slight variations based on local funeral customs. The djim's duty was to escort the spirit of the deceased to the spirit world.
document_data.Habitat: Djim were native to Kara-Tur and most often encountered on the island of [[Bawa]] and other islands within the [[Island Kingdoms]].
